metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
subscription id where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
resource group name where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

dataTypes.name: Akamai_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Akamai_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

Read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key)

customs.name: Subscription permissions
customs.description:
FIX!! You need permissions to create the data flow resources: 
- storage queues (notification queue and dead-letter queue) 
- event grid topic and subscription (to send 'blob created event' notifications to the notification queue) 
- role assignments (to grant access for sentinel app to the blob container and the storage queues.)

customs.name: FIXCollecting data from __ to your blob container
customs.description: Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://some-guide.net) for collecting data from __ to your blob container.

customs.name: Akamai Stream Directions
customs.description: Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://techdocs.akamai.com/datastream2/docs/stream-azure-storage) for configuring Akamai Stream to send data to an Azure Storage Account in your Tenant.

customs.name: Grant ScubaSentinelToStorageProd Enterpise Application permission to Azure Storage Account
customs.description: Grant ServicePrincipal ScubaSentinelToStorageProd Storage Blob Data Contributor to the Storage Account

instructionSteps.title: Connect Akamai Stream Logs to Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description:
To enable the Akamai Stream logs for Microsoft Sentinel, provide the required information below and click on Connect.
>

parameters.label: The blob container URL you want to collect data from
parameters.name: blobContainerUri

parameters.label: The blob container's storage account location
parameters.name: StorageAccountlocation

parameters.label: The blob container's storage account resource group name
parameters.name: StorageAccountResourceGroupName

parameters.label: The blob container's storage account subscription id
parameters.name: StorageAccountSubscription

parameters.label: The event grid topic name of the blob container's storage account if exist. else keep empty.
parameters.description:
The data flow using event grid to send 'blob-created event' notifications. There could be only one event grid topic for each storage account.
Go to your blob container's storage account and look in the 'Events' section. If you already have a topic, please provide it's name. Else, keep the text box empty.
parameters.name: EGSystemTopicName

Akamai_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

Read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key)

customs.name: Subscription permissions
customs.description:
You need permissions to create the data flow resources: 
- storage queues (notification queue and dead-letter queue) 
- event grid topic and subscription (to send 'blob created event' notifications to the notification queue) 
- role assignments (to grant access for sentinel app to the blob container and the storage queues.)

customs.name: Collecting data from __ to your blob container
customs.description: Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://some-guide.net) for collecting data from __ to your blob container.

customs.description: Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://techdocs.akamai.com/datastream2/docs/stream-azure-storage) for configuring Akamai Stream to send data to an Azure Storage Account in your Tenant.

customs.name: Grant ScubaSentinelToStorageProd Enterpise Application permission to Azure Storage Account
customs.description: Grant ServicePrincipal ScubaSentinelToStorageProd Storage Blob Data Contributor to the Storage Account

instructionSteps.title: Connect Akamai Stream Logs to Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description:
To enable the Akamai Stream logs for Microsoft Sentinel, provide the required information below and click on Connect.
>

parameters.label: The blob container URL you want to collect data from
parameters.name: blobContainerUri

parameters.label: The blob container's storage account location
parameters.name: StorageAccountlocation

parameters.label: The blob container's storage account resource group name
parameters.name: StorageAccountResourceGroupName

parameters.label: The blob container's storage account subscription id
parameters.name: StorageAccountSubscription

parameters.label: The event grid topic name of the blob container's storage account if exist. else keep empty.
parameters.description:
The data flow using event grid to send 'blob-created event' notifications. There could be only one event grid topic for each storage account.
Go to your blob container's storage account and look in the 'Events' section. If you already have a topic, please provide it's name. Else, keep the text box empty.
parameters.name: EGSystemTopicName
